channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2641] That's life Jim [Pic]
[+2179] You Are Here: A View Of Earth From Mars [PIC]
[+1987] Fox News Calls Mr. Rogers "An Evil, Evil Man"
item.description: "Little did I know, Mr. Rogers was an evil man. Bytelling children they're special just for being who they are, hehelped create this generation of worthless, lazy socialists." Only onFox News could a man who spent his life dedicated to public serviceand education be blamed for ruining generations of Americans.

item.title: [+1577] WTF CNN?
item.description: Compare CNN to real news.Try it.

item.title: [+1238] America Is Not At War [image]
item.description: This message was found at a US military facility in Ramadi, Iraq, written by a member of the US Marines.

item.title: [+1139] Adobe Strikes Back
item.description: Speaking about Mr. Jobs's assertion that Adobe is the No. 1 cause of Mac crashes, Mr. Narayan says if Adobe crashes Apple, that actually has something "to do with the Apple operating system."

item.title: [+1048] Obama breaks down in tears at funeral
item.description: The U.S. president was weeping openly as he watched the service for Dorothy Height in Washington today.

item.title: [+988] Iâ€™m Not O.J. (PIC)
[+975] First "Thor" Photo Revealed (PIC)
item.description: Paramount Pictures and Yahoo Movies have released the first shot of Australian actor Chris Hemsworth in costume as the Norse God and Marvel Comics hero "Thor" in Kenneth Branagh's upcoming film adaptation.

item.title: [+840] Raw Video: Quake Creates Pool Tsunami
item.description: A security camera in Mexicali was rolling when the 7.2 quake hit on Easter.

item.title: [+762] Stephen King's Dark Tower Set For Film Trilogy
item.description: In a whopping deal coming together quickly, Stephen King, Imagine Entertainment and Weed Road are in discussions to make a screen trilogy and TV series out of King's epic novel series The Dark Tower. Akiva Goldsman will write the script, Ron Howard will direct it.

item.title: [+760] I made a comic to illustrate my job (PIC)
[+723] Is Stephen Hawking right about aliens?
item.description: Stephen Hawking thinks that making contact with aliens would be a very bad idea indeed. But with new, massive telescopes, we humans are stepping up the search. Have we really thought this through?

item.title: [+713] Mario Diggs it, Do You? (pic)
item.description: We knew Mario was a dirty little plumber, as seen here Mario is appreciating Samus assets.

item.title: [+659] Microsoft Cancels Innovative Courier Tablet Project
item.description: According to sources familiar with the matter, Microsoft has cancelled Courier, the folding, two-screen prototype tablet that was first uncovered by Gizmodo.

item.title: [+658] Belgium Unites To Ban The Burqa
item.description: Belgium's French and Dutch parties have occasionally refused to even meet with each other and the linguistic divide colors nearly every aspect of politics here. The vote was 136-0 during the plenary session of the lower house of parliament this afternoon, outlawing the full Muslim veil as the "right thing to do".

item.title: [+633] 15 Hilarious No Parking Signs (pics)
[+608] 6 True Stories About Disneyland They Don't Want You to Know
item.description: What's that? You don't typically associate the Happiest Place on Earth with crippling depression, rabies, discrimination and hate crimes? We can fix that!

item.title: [+603] Conan: I would not have done the same to Leno
item.description: CBS has released an excerpt from its interview with Conan O'Brien...

item.title: [+567] North Korean Film Madness (Video)
item.description: Vice founder Shane Smith visits North Korea to try and penetrate the Korean Feature Film Studio, the state-run film production facility west of Pyongyang: a sprawling lot that at its height produced around 40 films a year.
